message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.SY 

The paper discusses security implications of one-sided network communication technologies such as RDMA and NVMe-over-Fabrics in datacenters and production software. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). It also discusses the impact of these technologies on network infrastructure and software systems, which suggests the category cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also mentions datacenters, which could fall under the category cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Additionally, the paper discusses the need for secure software systems, which could fall under the category cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper discusses the potential for leveraging one-sided communication to enhance security, which could fall under the category cs.SY (Systems and Control).
